intro: Gyrostachys spiralis, commonly known as spiral spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gyrostachys spiralis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and ease of care.
